title: Watch: Fraser Minten scores game-sealing goal for Bruins against his former team
author: Colin McCarthy
bullets: Fraser Minten scored an insurance goal to help the Boston Bruins defeat the Toronto Maple Leafs 5-3.
Minten formerly played for Toronto; he was traded to Boston in a deal involving Brandon Carlo.
The Bruins have now won six consecutive games with contributions from Minten and others like David Pastrnak.

title: Bruins legend Zdeno Chara describes ‘surreal’ induction into Hockey Hall of Fame
author: Colin McCarthy
bullets: Zdeno Chara was formally inducted into the Hockey Hall of Fame during a ceremony in Toronto on Saturday.
Chara received his Hall of Fame ring and plaque, sharing the honor with fellow inductee and former Bruin Joe Thornton.
Over his career, Chara was a seven-time All-Star, Norris Trophy winner, and led the Bruins to a Stanley Cup win in 2011.

title: What insiders are predicting for the Red Sox in free agency this offseason
author: Conor Roche
bullets: The Red Sox are positioned to spend this offseason with $219 million committed in payroll, below the luxury tax thresholds.
Insiders predict Boston as a favorite to re-sign Alex Bregman and potentially pursue Kyle Schwarber, Pete Alonso, and Dylan Cease.
Potential contract projections include Bregman at six years, $171 million and Schwarber at five years, $145 million.

title: Review & setlist: John Legend was a legendary pro at MGM Fenway (and he knew it)
author: Marc Hirsh
bullets: John Legend performed at MGM Music Hall at Fenway on November 7, 2025, commemorating 20 years since his debut album 'Get Lifted'.
Legend's setlist included most tracks from 'Get Lifted' as well as covers, showcasing his musical versatility and career accomplishments.
The concert featured Legend performing solo and with backup singers, seamlessly blending diverse musical styles and personal anecdotes.

title: Jaylen Brown seemingly criticizes officiating again following Celtics’ loss to Magic
author: Conor Roche
bullets: Jaylen Brown criticized officiating in postgame remarks following a 123-110 Celtics loss to the Magic.
Brown previously criticized refs after a 105-103 loss to the Jazz, citing a missed foul on Keyonte George.
Despite criticism, Brown wasn't fined; the NBA acknowledged a missed call in the last two-minute report of the Jazz game.

title: 5 things to know about Buccaneers ahead of Sunday’s game vs. Patriots
author: Conor Roche
bullets: Buccaneers quarterback Baker Mayfield is an MVP candidate with 1,919 yards, 13 touchdowns, and a 98.1 passer rating this season.
Rookie receiver Emeka Egbuka, with 562 yards and five touchdowns, is a contender for Offensive Rookie of the Year despite recent injuries.
Buccaneers will miss top receivers Chris Godwin and Mike Evans due to injuries in their Week 10 game against the Patriots.

title: Patriots’ return to relevance includes appearance by Jim Nantz in TV booth to call game for CBS
author: Chad Finn
bullets: Jim Nantz and Tony Romo return to call Patriots-Buccaneers game on CBS after two-year hiatus.
Patriots' improved performance, led by quarterback Drake Maye and coach Mike Vrabel, garners attention.
Jim Nantz has prior connection with Drake Maye, sharing the same agent and meeting before Super Bowl LVIII.

title: Magic pull away, beat Celtics despite another big Jaylen Brown game: 8 takeaways
author: Tom Westerholm
bullets: The Boston Celtics fell 123-110 to the Orlando Magic, marking their first NBA Cup loss despite Jaylen Brown's 32-point effort.
Jaylen Brown excelled with 32 points, but struggled from three-point range, shooting 1-for-6, impacting Celtics' comeback attempts.
Celtics' defense faltered, allowing Magic to hit 17 three-pointers, with Franz Wagner scoring 27 to lead Orlando's offensive push.

title: Public reprimand recommended for judge accused of helping immigrant escape ICE
author: Morgan Rousseau
bullets: Massachusetts Judge Shelley Joseph recommended for a public reprimand for creating an 'appearance of impropriety' in a 2018 ICE case.
Judge Joseph cleared of misconduct but found to have caused bias impression during off-the-record discussions at an arraignment.
Federal charges against Joseph were dropped in 2022; her reprimand aims to clarify her actions and allow closure.

title: Alex Cora still high on Red Sox’ future a month after being eliminated by Yankees
author: Kaley Brown
bullets: Red Sox manager Alex Cora expresses optimism for the team's future after playoff elimination by the Yankees.
Boston Red Sox finished third in their division with an 89-73 record, losing in the Wild Card Series.
Key roster changes include Trevor Story opting in, Alex Bregman opting out, and no qualifying offer for Lucas Giolito.
